title: Using a Top of the Line Hair Fan with Lindsay Adler
summary: Fashion photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates the advantages of using a professional-grade hair fan for commercial photography. She compares budget DIY solutions to the high-end Reel EFX RE Fan 2, details her specific lighting setup for hair campaigns, and conducts a photoshoot to show the results.

steps.action: Review budget hair blowing techniques including leaf blowers, floor dryers, and wafting with foam core.
steps.tool: Leaf Blower / Floor Dryer / Foam Core

steps.action: Explore the features of the Reel EFX RE Fan 2 Turbo, including variable power, burst mode, and beam control (10-45 degrees).
Set up the lighting: Clamshell lighting using a large umbrella as key and a strip softbox for fill, plus a bare bulb strobe for a background gradient.
steps.tool: Profoto D2, Large Umbrella, Strip Softbox

steps.action: Select camera gear: Canon EOS R5 with an RF 70-200mm lens to allow for both tight and wide compositions.
steps.tool: Canon EOS R5, Canon RF 70-200mm f/2.8 L IS USM

steps.action: Execute the photoshoot with a hairstylist operating the fan to achieve consistent, voluminous hair movement.

key_takeaways: Budget tools like leaf blowers can work but often lack consistency or cause frizz.
Professional fans offer precise control over wind speed and direction, crucial for commercial consistency.
Clamshell lighting is ideal for beauty and hair photography to create soft, high-key results.
A gradient background light adds depth compared to a flat-lit background.
Collaboration with a hairstylist is essential for achieving the perfect look.
